question.title: How to use Qmatic SDK connectors (e.g., BranchConnector) in a Spring Boot application?
question.body:
The Qmatic SDK documentation mentions that we can use their connectors (for example, BranchConnector) to retrieve data from the Qmatic system instead of calling the REST API directly.

However, the documentation is not very clear on how to actually use or configure these connectors within a Spring MVC / Spring Boot application. any idea how to implement it?

used their qmatic-common-api.jar file to implement it, but it always throw BeanNotFoundException

question_comments.body: Create a configuration with beans just as you would do if you would use it normally from Java. But now you can inject them into your code. If you know how to use the library in Java you can configure it from Spring as that is still just Java.
